comments: David is a super cool guy. I had him for my explore Chicago class and he was always nice and helpful, and he definitely knew the city enough to be teaching freshman about it. The homework in that class was super annoying but that isn\'t his fault.

comments: Great discussion. Requires a lot of effort out of class.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  TOUGH GRADER  GET READY TO READ
comments: If you choose Welch for Spies, you are making a big mistake. Personally, I go to him after every paper (3) to do better on the next one. I stay behind after class and participate actively and score well on the quiz. The way he grades is terrible, if you were to look at his rubric an A is a near perfect paper, how can English writing be perfect?

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Fact: Dave is super hot. Fact: He\'s a super tough grader, and he will obliterate you if you don\'t give his class your all. False: he\'s not arrogant or rude if you\'re not arrogant or rude. He\'s just really good at what he does. Take his class seriously and give it your all, and he\'ll take you seriously. Don\'t think you can mess around.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: writing classes are important but in this class i only see the opposite. when taught by welch the class hinges on general truths from general readings (nearly wikipedia writing advice), but welch teaches too romantic, too imaginary. any student wanting to take away something important about writing should avoid. take a class w/ any other prof.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  GET READY TO READ  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Welch is a great professor--hands down. I had him for a writing workshop and it was one of the best I\'ve taken at DePaul. He is intelligent and well read and gives excellent notes on your writing. He will also recommend writers and pieces for you that pertain to your writing, and he is more than willing to help you outside of class.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I\'ve never used this site before (because I\'ve never had an issue with a professor), but this guy is unnecessarily haughty at times. He\'s the typical "hip", young professor, so his attitude isn\'t exactly a surprise. Nice guy, good ideas, but values his own opinion (too) HIGHLY. Grades were inconsistent and feedback was vague (and often misspelled).

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I took Prof. Welch for a Creative Writing class, and thought he taught everything pretty well. He was pretty fair in grading everything except participation points for me, as I contributed every class and still got a B in that area. Good overall though.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Wonderful poet, and a generally fun professor.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: [Spy Literature Class] There will be a LOT of reading in his Spy lit class. its very interesting and his lectures are very useful and help give you a preview of EXACTLY what he wants in your work so pay attention. Due to the large amounts of reading there are very few other assignments so go to class and make sure you do them well and on time.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I took his focal point class about spy fiction and as long as you don\'t play sports or have a job outside this class you\'ll be fine. Be prepared to read one full novel per week and then have a alarmingly specific quiz every class period. David is extremely helpful outside of class however and he is a VERY smart guy. (He\'ll butcher your own writing)

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: wonderful. a writer\'s professor. if you are serious about writing well then listen to his lectures (the necessary and seemingly unnecessary), read what is given to you, maintain eye contact, and ask questions.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I think people are just bitter toward David as they don\'t want to work that hard. I was always able to get straight A\'s in school with BS work...no such luck here. He\'s too sharp; he always saw through it and challenged me. Lots of folks complained about him cause he didn\'t give easy A\'s in Spy Lit..god forbid you learn something in college, right?

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He is a knowledgeable guy, undoubtedly, but he is incredibly arrogant given that his creative work consists of a few poems. He is very much your prototypical hipster professor, so if that\'s what your after take his class by all means. I love to write, and he made me hate it a little bit. I\'m not a huge fan, much better professors at DePaul.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He is extremely arrogant. The materials he assigned us to read for creative writing were useless. They were so abstract. He felt overall if you didn\'t write in his style that you were not a good writer. I don\'t recommend his classes.I\'ve had way better writing classes.In fact,this was the worst writing class of my entire professional writing career

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I definitely recommend taking a class by D. Welch if you are interested in creative writing. He is very knowledgeable and challenges your writing. However, some people finds his lectures rant-like and useless. Not true. He\'s got some good stuff to say. Take him seriously, I have a feeling a lot of people take his class b/c he\'s attractive.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Golly, I still don\'t know how to take this dude. He\'s really cute and has a fairly fun class (as in, he has a sense of humor and enjoys what he does), but he\'s kind of arrogant! I\'d still recommend him in comparison to other professors, though. Good guy, I think? Great taste in lit.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: David is an amazing professor had him a yr ago. If you ask he is willing to help you in every way possible. He takes out the extra time to find authors and poets that match your style, and makes you feel like you have the potential to become a great writer. He is serious about his class and attendance, and if you are too you will learn a lot.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: If you like to write, take the class. If not, don\'t take the class. Professor may be...a little arrogant...but he sure is cute.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (5)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He is one of my favorite professors, I hope I have the opportunity to take him again. He\'s EXTREMELY helpful to students, all you have to do is ask. He is willing to put extra effort to helping a student understand whatever they are having an issue with.
